winner.translation[0].definitions[0].def: a person or animal that has won something
winner.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Five lucky winners will each receive a signed copy of the album.
As a jockey he rode 10 winners.
the winner of the Ladiesâ€™ Championship
winner.translation[0].definitions[1].def: someone or something that is or is likely to be very popular and successful
winner.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: The book has proved to be a winner with young children.
The company seems to be onto a winner  (=doing something that is likely to be successful).
winner.translation[0].definitions[2].def: a goal or point that makes someone win a game such as football or tennis
winner.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: Moran scored the winner with only two minutes left.
winner.translation[0].definitions[3].def: the person who gets most of the advantages from a situation
winner.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: In a capitalist society there will always be winners and losers.
The real winners this summer have been the sun cream manufacturers.
